page.title: 01Denbeath-a general intro
page.content: . Nine tenths of the area allocated for study by our group consists of sea.Denbeath is situated in the remaining grid square in the N.E. corner of the area. Denbeath, which is now dominated by the R.G.C. Offshore Fabrication Yard , was originally a mining community, growing up round the Wellesley Colliery, which was sunk in 1906 and finally closed on economic grounds in 1967. The R.G.C. yard is now on the site of the former colliery. The Wemyss Coal Co. built houses in various styles to accomodate their workforce.The Randolph Wemyss Memorial Hospital and Denbeath Public School,a secondary school then but a primary school now, were also built at that time.
